author: Robert Stickles
subject: Lupin in English FAQ and some good new/bad news
body:
Hi everyone,

     I should be posting an updated version of the Lupin in English FAQ 
within a day or two.  I usually do this from a different account since 
Hotmail's interface doesn't lend itself very well to large emails or pastes.

     On another note it's my sad duty to report that Odyssey Anime will 
cease to subtitle and distribute on January 31st.  In the past three years 
this group significantly contributed to Lupin III fandom by subtitling an 
impressive 6 TV specials and 2 theatrical films.  Odyssey also distributed 
their own work and frequently updated their previous work with error 
corrections and larger, more readable fonts.
     To Donna, Robert and everyone else connected to Odyssey it's been a 
great ride, thanks for all your efforts and I wish you all the best for the 
future.

     With that bit of a down note out of the way it's also come to my 
attention that Neko Creations has completed subtitling all of Lupin Sansei, 
the first tv series which premiered in 1971!  This 23 episode series 
contains quite a few key events in the Lupin mythos, such as the 
introduction of all the main characters, particularly Goemon Ishikawa who 
started off as villian and later joined the Lupin Gang.  The popularity of 
the original TV series even today is quite evident, particularly in Italy.  
The forthcoming OAV this year (the first such direct to video release for 
Lupin III in 15 years) is a direct sequel to Episode 2 of this TV series.

Regards,
Rob S.
